// About Me

Italy 2016

By Arun Varghese • 15 May 2016 • Travel

  • Gallery

Having been married for almost a year, my Wife and I decided on celebrating our anniversary by going on a trip to Italy. I will be honest, my wife planned over 99% of the trip. As a business analyst she knows how to be very thorough and created an itinerary that allowed us to see all the different sides of Italy and what it has to offer. Below is an outline of the places we saw and what we did.

Rome by

  • La Maison Del Corso
  • May 4th - May 6th
  • Piazza del Popolo, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Teatro de Marcello, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Trastevere, Roman Forums, Vatican City, St. Peter’s Basilica

Sorrento by

  • May 6th - May 8th
  • La Tonarella

  • Conca dei Marini, Positano, Amalfi, Revello, Hotel Sirenuse Terrace

  • Tours I recommend:
  • Private Amalfi Tour

Capri by

  • May 8th - May 9th
  • Capri Wine Hotel
  • Ana Capri, Blue Grotto

Florence by

  • May 9th - May 12th
  • Hotel Globus

  • Sienna, San Gimignano, Pisa, La Spezia, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza, Monterosso, Riomaggiore

  • Tours I recommend:
  • Best of Tuscany Tour
  • Cinque Terre Trek

Venice by

  • May 12th - May 13th
  • Hotel Palazzo Abadessa
  • Cantarini del Bovolo, Saint Mark’s Square, Grand Canal, Murano

Highlights from the trip!

Overall the trip was amazing, considering how much we covered in a short amount of time. We experienced the city life as well as life in the coastal towns. We tried authentic dishes, including pesto from where it was originated! My recommendations for planning a trip like this are to do day tours when possible, the convenience and experiences definitely outweigh the cost.



Welcome to my blog! This will mainly be used to talk about things I learn day to day as a developer, as well other things like travel, cars, life in general. Feel free to subscribe if any of this content resonates with you!
